meanings.sent1: The procumbent cat enjoyed a nap in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The procumbent grass made a soft bed for the insects.
meanings.sent3: The procumbent puppy looked like a furry rug on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The procumbent shadows stretched across the lawn like lazy giants.
meanings.sent5: The procumbent flowers seemed to be bowing to the earth.

meanings.sent1: The procumbent tree branches reached towards the ground.
meanings.sent2: Her procumbent posture showed her interest in the tiny flower.
meanings.sent3: The procumbent giraffe tried to reach a low-hanging leaf.
meanings.sent4: The procumbent hills seemed to be whispering secrets to the valley.
meanings.sent5: The procumbent student leaned eagerly towards the teacher.

meanings.definition: Growing along the ground without rising upright
meanings.sent1: The procumbent vines spread across the garden floor.
meanings.sent2: The procumbent ivy covered the entire wall with green leaves.
meanings.sent3: The procumbent caterpillar inched along the path slowly.
meanings.sent4: The procumbent river flowed gently through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The procumbent roots intertwined beneath the surface of the soil.
